availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eli Wheat (Adair County, Kentucky, saddler and judge)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, saddler and judge. Botetourt County, Virginia, native. Son of Joseph Wheat. Married to Elizabeth Allen Wheat in Adair County, Kentucky, on June 19, 1824. Father of Elizabeth E. Wheat, C. M. Wheat, John R. Wheat, Sophia S. Wheat, Benjamin F. Wheat, and Mattie E. Wheat. Married to Melia R. Moore Wheat in Adair County on May 28, 1863. Saddler in Adair County in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Adair County in 1850. Appointed county judge by Governor John L. Helm in Adair County in 1851. Saddler in Adair County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Adair County in 1860. Held one enslaved person in trust in Adair County in 1860.
